form_response: Today I woke up early. I did my puja, morning puja. Then I went to college and in college there was a lot of free time because we had company networks and the teacher was useless, so I studied a bit of DSA stuff, not exactly anything big. But like the basic data structures. Then I came home, I did my evening puja. Then I studied ATCD in the first study block, Automated Theory and Compiler Design. I did a bunch of that. There were a few things that, like I couldn't fit in a second study block because I had to go down for a walk like my mom told me to. There was no other option. So I had to go down for a walk and about an hour or half an hour was wasted on that. And other than that I did ATCD for more than the proposed time. So like I did it for a bit more than the study block because I wanted to understand everything before going to the next thing. Then I practiced music for the first time in a long time. Then I finished a bit of this stuff. So I basically completed this automation, this workflow, this whole thing was completed today. Then I also completed a few chapters of the Bhagavad Gita in my book. So like I'm making this book where the script is Telugu and the translation is English so that it's easy for me when I have to start taking classes. So I did a few chapters of that as well. And it's 10 minutes past my bedtime but I will go and sleep now. I feel like I've done a lot more than I usually would and there are a lot of things that I did a lot earlier than I usually would, so I'm kind of proud of myself. There's, I didn't stick to schedule strictly but also I managed to get a lot done today, so that's something.
completed_activities: Woke up early (before scheduled 5:00 AM), Performed morning puja, Attended college and studied DSA during free time, Performed evening puja, Studied Automated Theory and Compiler Design (ATCD) during Study Block 1 (extended duration), Practiced music, Completed automation/workflow project, Completed a few chapters of Bhagavad Gita (Telugu/English translation project), Went to sleep (10 minutes past bedtime)
missed_activities: Gita Classes (Batch A), Study Block 2, Wind down + Diya prep (likely rushed/skipped)
valid_reasons: Extended ATCD study to ensure understanding (academic commitment), Had to go for an obligatory walk with her mom (external family request)

gita.devanagari: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते ।तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम् ॥ ५० ॥
gita.transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛta-duṣkṛte tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam
gita.translation: A man engaged in devotional service rids himself of both good and bad reactions even in this life. Therefore strive for yoga, which is the art of all work.

krishna.reason: You know, for someone who 'didn't stick to schedule strictly,' you sure did get a lot done today! You balanced your academic commitments, spiritual practices, personal projects, and even that 'no other option' walk with mom, showing a good deal of initiative and adaptability. Keep that momentum, little devotee; it seems even I can't keep you down!
krishna.message: Alright, alright, so you thought you could trick me by 'not sticking to the schedule strictly,' huh? As if I wouldn't notice you actually nailing everything and then some! Balancing academics, spirituality, personal stuff, and even that 'oh no, not mom again' walk – without a single perfectly-timed alarm. Honestly, who needs rigid plans when you've got this much natural savvy? Guess that 'skill in action' thing really is rubbing off, isn't it? Keep that smart-aleck, adaptable spirit going; clearly, my lessons are sinking in, one gloriously chaotic success at a time!
